original: Laṭukikopamasutta

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā aṅguttarāpesu viharati āpaṇaṁ nāma aṅguttarāpānaṁ nigamo.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā aṅguttarāpesu viharati āpaṇam nāma aṅguttarāpānam nigamaḥ
translated: Once the Buddha was staying in the Anguttara country at a town of the Anguttara people called Apana.

original: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya āpaṇaṁ piṇḍāya pāvisi.🔽Āpaṇe piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṁ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto yenaññataro vanasaṇḍo tenupasaṅkami divāvihārāya.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇha samayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya āpaṇam piṇḍāya pāvisi  āpaṇe piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattam piṇḍapāta paṭikkantaḥ yena aññataraḥ vana saṇḍo tena upasaṅkami divāvihārāya
translated: Then, in the morning, the Buddha put on his robe and took his bowl and went into Apana for alms. 🔽After his meal, when he had returned from his alms round, he went to a certain grove for the day’s meditation.

original: Taṁ vanasaṇḍaṁ ajjhogāhetvā aññatarasmiṁ rukkhamūle divāvihāraṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: tam vana saṇḍam ajjhogāhetvā aññatarasmim rukkha mūle divāvihāram nisīdi
translated: He entered the grove, went to a certain tree, and sat down at its foot for the day’s meditation.

original: Āyasmāpi kho udāyī pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya āpaṇaṁ piṇḍāya pāvisi.🔽Āpaṇe piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṁ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto yena so vanasaṇḍo tenupasaṅkami divāvihārāya.
analyzed: āyasmā api kho udāyī pubbaṇhasamayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya āpaṇam piṇḍāya pāvisi  āpaṇe piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattam piṇḍapāta paṭikkantaḥ yena saḥ vana saṇḍo tena upasaṅkami divāvihārāya
translated: Venerable Udāyī also put on his robe and took his bowl and went into Apana for alms. 🔽After his meal, when he had returned from his alms round, he went to that grove for the day’s meditation.

original: Taṁ vanasaṇḍaṁ ajjhogāhetvā aññatarasmiṁ rukkhamūle divāvihāraṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: tam vana saṇḍam ajjhogāhetvā aññatarasmim rukkha mūle divāvihāram nisīdi
translated: He entered the grove, went to a certain tree, and sat down at its foot for the day’s meditation.

original: Atha kho āyasmato udāyissa rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṁ cetaso parivitakko udapādi:
analyzed: atha kho āyasmataḥ udāyissa rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evam cetasaḥ parivitakkaḥ udapādi
translated: Then, while reflecting in private, Venerable Udāyī thought,

original: “bahūnaṁ vata no bhagavā dukkhadhammānaṁ apahattā, bahūnaṁ vata no bhagavā sukhadhammānaṁ upahattā;
analyzed: bahūnam vata naḥ bhagavā dukkha dhammānam apahattā bahūnam vata naḥ bhagavā sukha dhammānam upahattā
translated: “The Buddha has removed so many things that are unwholesome and brought forth so many things that are wholesome.

original: bahūnaṁ vata no bhagavā akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ apahattā, bahūnaṁ vata no bhagavā kusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ upahattā”ti.🔽Atha kho āyasmā udāyī sāyanhasamayaṁ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami;
analyzed: bahūnam vata naḥ bhagavā akusalānam dhammānam apahattā bahūnam vata naḥ bhagavā kusalānam dhammānam upahattā ati  atha kho āyasmai udāyī sāyanha samayam paṭisallānā vuṭṭhitaḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami
translated: He has removed so many things that are painful and brought forth so many things that are pleasant.”🔽Then, in the evening, Udāyī came out of retreat, went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

original: upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho āyasmā🔽udāyī bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:🔽“idha mayhaṁ, bhante, rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṁ cetaso parivitakko udapādi:
analyzed: upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ khalu āyasmā  udāyī bhagavantam etat avoca  idha bhante rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evam cetasaḥ parivitakkaḥ udapādi
translated: and told him what he had been thinking.

original: ‘bahūnaṁ vata no bhagavā dukkhadhammānaṁ apahattā, bahūnaṁ vata no bhagavā sukhadhammānaṁ upahattā;
analyzed: bahūnam vata naḥ bhagavā dukkha dhammānam apahattā bahūnam vata naḥ bhagavā sukha dhammānam upahattā
translated: “Udāyī, I have removed the unwholesome and brought forth the wholesome,🔽I have removed the painful and brought forth the pleasant.”

original: bahūnaṁ vata no bhagavā akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ apahattā, bahūnaṁ vata no bhagavā kusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ upahattā’ti.
analyzed: bahūnam vata naḥ bhagavā akusalānam dhammānam apahattā bahūnam vata naḥ bhagavā kusalānam dhammānam upahattā ati
translated: The Blessed One has removed many unwholesome things and established us in many wholesome things.’

original: Mayañhi, bhante, pubbe sāyañceva bhuñjāma pāto ca divā ca vikāle.
analyzed: mayan hi bhante pubbe sāyam ca iva bhuñjāma pāto ca divā ca vikāle
translated: “Previously, we ate in the evening, in the morning, and during the day outside of the proper time.

original: Ahu kho so, bhante, samayo yaṁ bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi:
analyzed: ahu kho saḥ bhante samayaḥ yam bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: There was an occasion when the Blessed One addressed the bhikkhus thus:

original: ‘iṅgha tumhe, bhikkhave, etaṁ divāvikālabhojanaṁ pajahathā’ti.
analyzed: tumhe bhikkhave etam divā vikālabhojanam pajahatha ati
translated: ‘Come, bhikkhus, abandon eating in the evening, in the morning, and during the day outside of the proper time.’

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, bhante, ahudeva aññathattaṁ, ahudeva domanassaṁ:
analyzed: tassa mayha bhante ahudeva aññathatta ahudeva domanassa
translated: I was upset and sad, thinking:🔽‘The Blessed One asks us to abandon eating in the evening, in the morning, and during the day outside of the proper time.

original: ‘yampi no saddhā gahapatikā divā vikāle paṇītaṁ khādanīyaṁ bhojanīyaṁ denti tassapi no bhagavā pahānamāha, tassapi no sugato paṭinissaggamāhā’ti.
analyzed: yam pi no saddhāḥ gahapatikāḥ divā vikāle paṇītam khādanīyam bhojanīyam denti tassa api naḥ bhagavā pahānam āha tassa api no sugataḥ paṭinissaggam āha ati
translated: The Blessed One asks us to abandon what the faithful householders give us in the evening, in the morning, and during the day outside of the proper time.’

original: Te mayaṁ, bhante, bhagavati pemañca gāravañca hiriñca ottappañca sampassamānā evaṁ taṁ divāvikālabhojanaṁ pajahimhā.
analyzed: te bhante bhagavati pemañca gāravañca hiriñca ottappañca sampassamānāḥ evam tam divā vikālabhojanam pajahimhā
translated: But, venerable sir, we had affection and respect for the Blessed One, and we were afraid of doing what is blameworthy. So we abandoned eating in the evening, in the morning, and during the day outside of the proper time.

original: Te mayaṁ, bhante, sāyañceva bhuñjāma pāto ca.
analyzed: te bhante sāyañca iva bhuñjāma ca
translated: We ate in the evening and in the morning.

original: Ahu kho so, bhante, samayo yaṁ bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi:
analyzed: ahu kho saḥ bhante samayaḥ yam bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: There was an occasion, venerable Sir, when the Fortunate One addressed the monks, (saying):

original: ‘iṅgha tumhe, bhikkhave, etaṁ rattiṁvikālabhojanaṁ pajahathā’ti.
analyzed: tumhe bhikkhave etam ratti vikāla bhojanam pajahatha ati
translated: ‘Come monks, give up eating in the evening.’

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, bhante, ahudeva aññathattaṁ ahudeva domanassaṁ:
analyzed: tassa bhante ahudeva aññathattam ahudeva domanassa
translated: Then, venerable Sir, I had this thought:

original: ‘yampi no imesaṁ dvinnaṁ bhattānaṁ paṇītasaṅkhātataraṁ tassapi no bhagavā pahānamāha, tassapi no sugato paṭinissaggamāhā’ti.
analyzed: yam pi no imesam dvinnam bhattānam paṇīta saṅkhātataram tassa api naḥ bhagavā pahānam āha tassa api naḥ sugataḥ paṭinissaggam āha ati
translated: ‘Even that which is the most excellent of our two meals the Fortunate One says should be given up, the Fortunate One says should be abandoned.’

original: Bhūtapubbaṁ, bhante, aññataro puriso divā sūpeyyaṁ labhitvā evamāha:
analyzed: bhūta pubba bhante aññataraḥ purisaḥ divā sūpeyyam labhitvā evam āha
translated: It so happened, venerable Sir, that a certain man having obtained soup during the day, said this:

original: ‘handa ca imaṁ nikkhipatha, sāyaṁ sabbeva samaggā bhuñjissāmā’ti.
analyzed: handa ca imam nikkhipatha sāyam sabbe iva samaggāḥ bhuñjissāma ati
translated: ‘Come on, put this aside, in the evening we will all eat together.’

original: Yā kāci, bhante, saṅkhatiyo sabbā tā rattiṁ, appā divā.
analyzed: yā kāci bhante saṅkhatiyaḥ sabbā tā ratti appā divā
translated: Whatever kinds of soup there are, venerable Sir, all of them are at night, few are during the day.

original: Te mayaṁ, bhante, bhagavati pemañca gāravañca hiriñca ottappañca sampassamānā evaṁ taṁ rattiṁvikālabhojanaṁ pajahimhā.
analyzed: te bhante bhagavati pemañca gāravañca hiriñca ottappañca sampassamānāḥ evam tam ratti vikāla bhojanam pajahimhā
translated: But we, venerable Sir, seeing love and respect and shame and moral dread towards the Fortunate One, gave up that eating in the evening.

original: Bhūtapubbaṁ, bhante, bhikkhū rattandhakāratimisāyaṁ piṇḍāya carantā candanikampi
analyzed: bhūta pubba bhante bhikkhū ratta ndhakāra timi sāyam piṇḍāya carantā
translated: It so happened, venerable Sir, that monks, walking for alms during the night in the darkness of the night, stepped on a dog, and

original: pavisanti, oligallepi papatanti, kaṇṭakāvāṭampi ārohanti, suttampi gāviṁ ārohanti,
analyzed: pavisanti oligallepi papatanti kaṇṭakāvāṭam pi ārohanti suttam pi gāvim ārohanti
translated: They enter, fall into deep ravines, climb up thorny trees, climb up cows that are tethered,

original: māṇavehipi samāgacchanti katakammehipi akatakammehipi, mātugāmopi te asaddhammena nimanteti.🔽Bhūtapubbāhaṁ, bhante, rattandhakāratimisāyaṁ piṇḍāya carāmi.
analyzed: samāgacchanti kata kammehi pi a kata kammehi mātugāmaḥ upi te asat dhammena nimanteti  bhūta pubbā āha bhante ratta ndhakāra timi sāyam piṇḍāya carāmi
translated: and they meet with young men, both those who have done what they had to do and those who haven’t. And women invite them with wrong conduct.🔽“Once, Sir, I was walking for almsfood in the dark of night.

original: Addasā kho maṁ, bhante, aññatarā itthī vijjantarikāya bhājanaṁ dhovantī.
analyzed: addasā kho ma bhante aññatarā itthī vijjantarikāya bhājanam dhovantī
translated: A certain woman saw me washing a dish by the light of a flash of lightning.

original: Disvā maṁ bhītā vissaramakāsi:
analyzed: disvā mam bhītā vissaram akāsi
translated: When she saw me, she cried out in terror:

original: ‘abhumme pisāco vata man’ti.
analyzed: abhumme pisācaḥ vata manti
translated: ‘A non-human spirit on the loose!’

original: Evaṁ vutte, ahaṁ, bhante, taṁ itthiṁ etadavocaṁ:
analyzed: evam vutte aha bhante tam itthim etat avoca
translated: When that was said, I said to her,

original: ‘nāhaṁ, bhagini, pisāco;
analyzed: na āha bhagini pisāco
translated: ‘Sister, I’m not a non-human spirit.

original: bhikkhu piṇḍāya ṭhito’ti.
analyzed: bhikkhu piṇḍāya ṭhito ti
translated: I’m a monk standing for almsfood.’

original: ‘Bhikkhussa ātumārī, bhikkhussa mātumārī.
analyzed: bhikkhussa ātumārī bhikkhussa mātumārī
translated: ‘A monk-killer, a monk-killer!’

original: Varaṁ te, bhikkhu, tiṇhena govikantanena kucchi parikanto, na tveva varaṁ yaṁ rattandhakāratimisāyaṁ kucchihetu piṇḍāya carasī’ti.
analyzed: varam te bhikkhu tiṇhena go vikantanena kucchi parikanto na tu eva varam yam ratta ndhakāra timi sāyam kucchi hetu piṇḍāya carasi iti
translated: ‘It would be better for you, monk, to be stabbed in the belly with a sharp butcher’s knife than to walk for almsfood in the dark of night for the sake of your belly.’

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, bhante, tadanussarato evaṁ hoti:
analyzed: tassa bhante tat anussarataḥ evam hoti
translated: “Sir, as I recall that, I think:

original: ‘bahūnaṁ vata no bhagavā dukkhadhammānaṁ apahattā, bahūnaṁ vata no bhagavā sukhadhammānaṁ upahattā;
analyzed: bahūnam vata naḥ bhagavā dukkha dhammānam apahattā bahūnam vata naḥ bhagavā sukha dhammānam upahattā
translated: ‘The Blessed One has removed many painful things and brought about many pleasant things for us.

original: bahūnaṁ vata no bhagavā akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ apahattā, bahūnaṁ vata no bhagavā kusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ upahattā’”ti.
analyzed: bahūnam vata naḥ bhagavā akusalānam dhammānam apahattā bahūnam vata naḥ bhagavā kusalānam dhammānam upahattā ati
translated: He has removed many unskillful things and brought about many skillful things for us.’

original: “Evameva panudāyi, idhekacce moghapurisā ‘idaṁ pajahathā’ti mayā vuccamānā te evamāhaṁsu:
analyzed: evam eva idha ekacce mogha purisāḥ idam pajahatha ati mayā vuccamānā te evam āhasu
translated: “So too, Udāyī, when I say, ‘Abandon this,’ some foolish men say to me,

original: ‘kiṁ panimassa appamattakassa oramattakassa adhisallikhatevāyaṁ samaṇo’ti.
analyzed: kim panimassa appamattakassa ora mattakassa adhisallikhatā iva ayam samaṇaḥ ti
translated: ‘What’s the point of abandoning this little thing? This ascetic is just looking for trouble.’

original: Te tañceva nappajahanti, mayi ca appaccayaṁ upaṭṭhāpenti.
analyzed: te tat ca iva na pajahanti mayi ca appaccayam upaṭṭhāpenti
translated: They don’t abandon it, but they treat me with contempt.

original: Ye ca bhikkhū sikkhākāmā tesaṁ taṁ, udāyi, hoti balavaṁ bandhanaṁ, daḷhaṁ bandhanaṁ, thiraṁ bandhanaṁ, apūtikaṁ bandhanaṁ, thūlo, kaliṅgaro—
analyzed: ye ca bhikkhū sikkhā kāmā tesam te udāyi hoti balavam daḷham bandhana thiram bandhana a pūtikam bandhana thūlaḥ kaliṅgaro
translated: But for those monks who want the training, that’s a strong, tight, firm, unrotting fetter, a great, heavy chain.

original: seyyathāpi, udāyi, laṭukikā sakuṇikā pūtilatāya bandhanena baddhā tattheva vadhaṁ vā bandhaṁ vā maraṇaṁ vā āgameti.
analyzed: sā iyyathā api udāyi laṭukikā sa kuṇikā pūtilatāya bandhanena baddhā tattha iva vadham vā bandham vā maraṇam vā āgameti
translated: It’s like a quail chick bound with a rotting vine. It just stays there, dying right there.

original: Yo nu kho, udāyi, evaṁ vadeyya:🔽‘yena sā laṭukikā sakuṇikā pūtilatāya bandhanena baddhā tattheva vadhaṁ vā bandhaṁ
analyzed: yaḥ nu khalu udāyi evam vadeyya  yena sā laṭukikā sa kuṇikā pūtilatāya bandhanena baddhā tatthā iva vadham vā bandha
translated: “Udāyī, if someone were to say:

original: vā maraṇaṁ vā āgameti, tañhi tassā abalaṁ bandhanaṁ, dubbalaṁ bandhanaṁ, pūtikaṁ
analyzed: vā maraṇam vā āgameti tat hi tassāḥ abalam bandhana dubbalam bandhana pūtika
translated: ‘The little bird is bound by a rotting vine. Wherever it goes, it will come to a bad end, to bondage,

original: bandhanaṁ, asārakaṁ bandhanan’ti;
analyzed: asārakam
translated: to death, or to despair,’

original: sammā nu kho so, udāyi, vadamāno vadeyyā”ti?
analyzed: sammā nu kho saḥ udāyi vadamānaḥ vadeyya ati
translated: would he be speaking rightly?”

original: “No hetaṁ, bhante.
analyzed: naḥ heta bhante
translated: “No, venerable sir.

original: Yena sā, bhante, laṭukikā sakuṇikā pūtilatāya bandhanena baddhā tattheva vadhaṁ vā🔽bandhaṁ vā maraṇaṁ vā āgameti, tañhi tassā balavaṁ bandhanaṁ, daḷhaṁ bandhanaṁ, thiraṁ
analyzed: yena sā bhante laṭukikā sa kuṇikā pūtilatāya bandhanena baddhā tattha iva vadham vā  bandham vā maraṇam vā āgameti tat hi tassā balavam bandhana daḷham bandhana thira
translated: The little bird is bound by a rotting vine. Wherever it goes, it will come to a bad end, to bondage,

original: bandhanaṁ apūtikaṁ bandhanaṁ, thūlo, kaliṅgaro”ti.
analyzed: bandhanam a pūtikam
translated: to death, or to despair. That is a strong bond, a firm bond, a tight bond, an unrotting bond, a thick bond, a tough bond.”

original: “Evameva kho, udāyi, idhekacce moghapurisā ‘idaṁ pajahathā’ti mayā vuccamānā te evamāhaṁsu:
analyzed: evam eva kho udāyi idha ekacce mogha purisāḥ idam pajahatha ati mayā vuccamānā te evam āhasu
translated: “So too, Udāyī, here some worthless men, when told by me, ‘Abandon this,’ say:

original: ‘kiṁ panimassa appamattakassa oramattakassa adhisallikhatevāyaṁ samaṇo’ti?
analyzed: kim panimassa appamattakassa ora mattakassa adhisallikhatā iva ayam samaṇaḥ ti
translated: ‘What is this trifling thing? This recluse is too exacting.’

original: Te tañceva nappajahanti, mayi ca appaccayaṁ upaṭṭhāpenti.
analyzed: te tat ca iva na pajahanti mayi ca appaccayam upaṭṭhāpenti
translated: They don’t give up that thing, and they don’t attend to me with respect.

original: Ye ca bhikkhū sikkhākāmā tesaṁ taṁ, udāyi, hoti balavaṁ bandhanaṁ, daḷhaṁ bandhanaṁ, thiraṁ bandhanaṁ, apūtikaṁ bandhanaṁ, thūlo, kaliṅgaro.
analyzed: ye ca bhikkhū sikkhā kāmā tesam te udāyi hoti balavam daḷham bandhana thiram bandhana a pūtikam bandhana thūlaḥ kaliṅgaro
translated: But for those monks who want the training, that thing becomes a strong, firm, stable, unrotting, thick, and heavy fetter.

original: Idha panudāyi, ekacce kulaputtā ‘idaṁ pajahathā’ti mayā vuccamānā te evamāhaṁsu:
analyzed: ekacce kula puttāḥ idam pajahatha ati mayā vuccamānā te evam āhasu
translated: But, Udayin, some of these gentlemen, when told by me to give up a thing, say this:

original: ‘kiṁ panimassa appamattakassa oramattakassa pahātabbassa yassa no bhagavā pahānamāha, yassa no sugato paṭinissaggamāhā’ti?
analyzed: kim panimassa appamattakassa ora mattakassa pahātabbassa yassa naḥ bhagavā pahānam āha yassa no sugataḥ paṭinissaggam āha ati
translated: ‘What’s the point of giving up this little thing, this trifle, which the Blessed One says should be given up, which the One of Good Conduct says should be relinquished?’

original: Te tañceva pajahanti, mayi ca na appaccayaṁ upaṭṭhāpenti.
analyzed: te tat ca iva pajahanti mayi ca na appaccayam upaṭṭhāpenti
translated: They give up that thing, but they don’t attend to me with respect.

original: Ye ca bhikkhū sikkhākāmā te taṁ pahāya appossukkā pannalomā paradattavuttā migabhūtena cetasā viharanti.🔽Tesaṁ taṁ, udāyi, hoti abalaṁ bandhanaṁ, dubbalaṁ bandhanaṁ, pūtikaṁ bandhanaṁ, asārakaṁ bandhanaṁ—
analyzed: ye ca bhikkhū sikkhā kāmā te tam pahāya appa ussukkā panna lomā para datta vuttā miga bhūtena cetasā viharanti 🔽tesam te udāyi hoti abalam bandhana dubbalam bandhana pūtikam bandhana asārakam bandhana
translated: But for those monks who want the training, that thing, having been given up, becomes a weak, feeble, rotten, worthless fetter.

original: seyyathāpi, udāyi, rañño nāgo īsādanto urūḷhavā abhijāto saṅgāmāvacaro daḷhehi varattehi🔽bandhanehi baddho īsakaṁyeva kāyaṁ sannāmetvā tāni bandhanāni saṁchinditvā sampadāletvā
analyzed: seyyathā api udāyi raññaḥ nāgaḥ īsādantaḥ urūḷhavā abhijātaḥ saṅgāma avacaraḥ daḷhehi varattehi  bandhanehi baddhaḥ īsakayā iva kāyam tāni bandhanāni sa chinditvā sampadāletvā
translated: fully grown, in the prime of his life,🔽might twist and tear his strong, stout,
